intro: Claytonia vassilievii, commonly known as the Sierra White Flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a low-growing habit with rosettes of fleshy, succulent leaves. Claytonia vassilievii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in moist, well-drained habitats.
